intro: Peristrophe albiflora var. blumeana, commonly known as the white-flowered peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
